channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2024110621
item.description:
Report X-2024110621

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-19T12:23:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-17
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor at service center 064 contacted Safety regarding a slow leak from one of the corners of a tote containing corrosive liquid that spilled on the trailer and dock floor. The operations supervisor advised the tote did not appear to be punctured. The tote was briefly moved to the do ck, but when it continued to leak it was moved back to the trailer to contain the leak. Brandon Baumann with CURA advised the cleaning crew discovered the tote to be leaking from a defective valve.

item.title: Report E-2024110268
item.description:
Report E-2024110268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 8, 2024. one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized granular absorbents. hand tools, absorbent pads, and cleaning agent to remediate the site. All impacted materials were collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum, and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110122
item.description:
Report E-2024110122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: MILFORD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WORLD FUEL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7081
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/18/2024, a World Fuel Service, Inc. (WFS) transport driver when starting their shift at 04:30 called the HSE Manager to report a spill at the WFS Milford Bulk Plant. They reported there was diesel spilled throughout the facility yard and onto US HWY 50. The transport driver did know who caused it. They provided pictures and was allowed to start their shift. The HSE Manager and Milford Operations Manager went to the site to further investigate the release and its severity. After arriving to the Milford yard it was clear that someone had loaded a tank wagon and spilled product without notifying anyone. The HSE Manager and Operations Manager looked at unit 865 and it was clear the truck had an overfill and product had spilled over top of it. Th truck had fuel staining on the tanker and on the front/back of the it. HSE and Operations spoke with both night drivers and confirmed who used unit 865. When speaking with driver that used 865, they stated that they did not know about or caused any spill. The driver had started their shift at 17:30 on 10/17/2024. Footage was pulled from the truck camera system in order to determine the cause of the release. Camera footage showed the driver loading from 06:00 pm to around 06:35 pm. Camera footage showed the driver causing a spill of diesel from the truck after loading. It showed the driver pulling out of the loading bay and then back in the loading bay spilling product. Next, the driver gets out to look at the truck top, then gets back in the truck and backs out of loading bay and pulls around circling in the yard. Then, parks 10 feet away from a storm drain at the facility while product is still being released to the ground from the truck top. Next, the driver gets out and looks at the spill. During this time the driver does not take any action to stop or slow the spill nor did they report it to HSE or Operations. The driver was not following procedures and neglected to take any actions addressing the spill. Finally, the driver walks into the office building, comes back out and proceeds to leave the yard. When doing so more diesel is spilled. The majority of diesel is spilled in the facility yard. The driver turns right (west) onto US HWY 50. Product splashes off the truck onto the road way for several hundred yards. The driver finished his shift, returned to the yard and parked the truck back at the Milford Facility without reporting the release. Approximately 30 gallons of diesel fuel was spilled. HEPACO was contacted on 10/18/2024 at 04:57 and was dispatched to clean up the spill. One storm drain was impacted at the WFS facility and the diesel fuel was contained to the catch basin and recovered. Weather conditions were dry and there was no precipitation. On 10/18/2024 between 07:56 and 12:31 the NRC, Ohio EPA, Clermont Co. EMA, and Miami TWP Fire Dept. were notified of the spilled. Diesel that spilled on to US HWY 50 was not cleaned up and no roadway safety issues were reported. HEPACO finished the

item.title: Report E-2024110259
item.description:
Report E-2024110259

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1242 ET, Jed Burga with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XUR. It was reported that an unknown amount of UN3253 released from paper bags due to improper shipper loading. The release impacted Dock 3. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was dispatched and observed eight torn bags that released approximately 1-cup of product onto the concrete dock floor, adjacent product, and plastic shrink-wrap. The concrete dock floor was impacted in a 1’x1’ area. The product was damaged due to improper loading by the Shipper. The contractor overpacked the damaged bag, containerized the floor sweepings of product and the impacted shrink-wrap. In total, five drums of waste were generated that were staged on-site for XPO to manage.

Contractor sent to attempt to tighten valve, but this did not work at it was found that it was coming from above that. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION PLASTIC PAIL INSIDE WAS MARKED WITH A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND ON THE SIDE OF THE PAIL MAKING THIS AN UNDECLARED PACKAGE. THIS PRODUCT BARES TWO DIFFERENT COMPONETS THE SECOND COMPONENT IS ISOPHORONEDIAMINE, MIXTURE UN2289, 8, PACKING GROUP III. i HAVE EMAILED THE COMPANY FOR THE CORRECT MSDS.

  • City: WILMINGTON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 5, 2024, oen (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN3266-impacted impacted dock floor. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon lined poly drums for disposal.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: UNIONTOWN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:37 PM ET, XAC contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside of a trailer in Uniontown, OH. The spill consists of approximately 1 pint of All Purpose Clear Regular Bodied Low VOC Cement, which released from (1) 1 pint metal can due to a shipper loading error which caused the can to be damaged inside the box, spilling out onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents and place the contents into a 20-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024110218
item.description:
Report E-2024110218

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-29
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 8ft-by-50ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to a defective metal drum. EnviroServe personnel used hand tools and absorbent rags to removed the solidified material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and the defective drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the J.B. Hunt terminal pending profile approval.

item.title: Report E-2024110190
item.description:
Report E-2024110190

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0254 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCO. It was reported that approximately 1 cup of Meritech Boot Cleaner XP Solution was released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to improper bracing and blocking by terminal BIN. The release impacted trailer #3212451. The spill was contained inside the box. Terminal Personnel placed the box into a 10-gallon metal drum.
